data: Fall harvest highlights include freshly pressed apple cider made from farm apples; 15 to 20 varieties of apples; plenty of fall décor, including corn stalks and gourds; a hay maze for kids (no charge) and a U-pick pumpkin patch (opens in mid October). Weekend hours: 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday and Saturday; noon to 5 p.m. Sunday.

Weekend events continue through October, with Apple Daze Kickoff, Oct. 3-4; Apple Daze Fall Harvest, Oct. 10-11; Apple Daze and Pumpkins, Oct. 17-18; Apple Daze and Halloween Costume Contest, Oct. 24-25. Highlights throughout October include a family-friendly corn maze; fall décor, including fall and winter squash, pumpkins, gourds, corn stalks, hay bales, etc.; apple cobbler and apple cider; hay maze and tractor rides for kids; an apple blaster; and a U-pick pumpkin patch. Weekend hours: 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sunday.
FOOD for Lane County’s Youth Farm

Support feeding Lane County’s hungry as well as the good works of volunteer youths with pumpkins and other fall produce purchases at the farm stand through October. The stand is open from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday.
FOOD for Lane County’s Youth Farm

This farm stand north in Linn County is well worth a country drive what with fall produce, including winter gourds and pie pumpkins, and a restaurant open for breakfast on Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Also special prix fixe dinners begin at 6:30 p.m. on Fridays through October, beginning Oct. 9. Cost is $32; seating is limited so reservations are a must. Farm stand weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturday; closed Sunday, through October.
U-pick pumpkin patch opens early October; fall harvest includes pumpkins, gourds, apples. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday.

Special Octoberfest event is Oct. 17-18, with tethered hot air balloon rides beginning at 7 a.m. both days, tractor trailer rides to the pumpkin patch, face painting and barbecue, featuring burgers, chicken, hot dogs and brats. Ongoing harvest highlights through October include tractor trailer rides to the U-pick pumpkin patch; seasonal produce such as beets, carrots, pumpkins, apples, pears. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday, through November.

Fall harvest highlights include hayrides to U-pick pumpkin patch ($1 per person); fall décor such as gourds and corn stalks; fall produce such as apples and pears; and locally made goodies including Paula Herrick’s Jams and Jellies, various pickled goods, Kopper Kettle caramel corns and caramel apples. Also freshly harvested hazelnuts. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday, through December.

“Crazy Hayrides” to the U-pick pumpkin patch feature gourd tossing, bungee launching and pelting scarecrows in the fields with “ammo” provided ($5 per person). Last hayride goes out a half hour before closing. The farm stand includes plenty of seasonal produce and other treats. Weekend hours: 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sunday through October.

Offers many seasonal activities including the Pumpkin Patch Express, with transport to the U-pick pumpkin patches via either tractor-drawn wagon ($4 for ages 1 and older) or drafthorse-drawn wagon (weather permitting, $5 for ages 1 and older); the Cow Train Trail Ride over the grassy knolls ($4.50 for ages 3 and older); and the 10-acre Corn Maze, with both a nonhaunted version for the daytime (10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily; $5 ages 11 and younger, $7 ages 12 and older) and a haunted version weekend nights only (7:30 p.m. to 10 p.m.; $18 Friday and Saturday, $15 Sunday). The Barnyard Cafe (open from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Friday through Sunday only) serves seasonal treats such as caramel apples, pumpkin spice, apple cider doughnuts, hot apple cider as well as barbecue hamburgers and roasted corn. Lone Pine Farms’ weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Friday through Sunday, through Oct. 31, unless otherwise noted.

Plenty of fall décor, with already-picked pumpkins, ornamental gourds and squash, as well as cold weather crops including fall apples, broccoli, cabbage, etc. Pears, too. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday; closed Sunday until the last two weeks before Halloween, when the farm also will remain open on Sundays.
Garden Avenue and Highway 20 Corvallis OR

Looking for an adventure outside of Eugene/Springfield? The Melon Shack has a nonhaunted corn maze open daily from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. throughout October ($5 for ages 4 and older; free for 3 and younger). The corn maze turns haunted from 7:30 p.m. to 10 p.m. on Friday and Saturday nights starting Oct. 9 ($10). Other goodies on the farm include U-pick pumpkins, a hay bale fort, fall décor, including gourds and corn stalks, and various delicious treats such as doughnuts and kettle corn. Weekend hours: 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday unless otherwise noted. The Melon Shack is on Facebook.

A Scarecrow Making and Pumpkin Carving Workshop is from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 18 at Mount Pisgah Arboretum, 34901 Frank Parrish Road. Learn pumpkin carving techniques or design your own scarecrow to enter in the annual contest at the arboretum during the Mushroom Festival, Oct. 25. Pants, shirts, straw and pumpkins are provided. Cost is $5 per pumpkin or scarecrow. No registration is required.

Annual Colonial Harvest Days are underway through Oct. 31. New this year is the farm’s first-ever “Conquer the Corn” maze (open through Nov. 15), with a farm scene investigation game for older kids and adults, and a smaller corn maze geared to younger children. Weekend hours for the maze are from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday, and from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Sunday. Admission to the maze is $7.50 for ages 12 and older, $5 for ages 4 to 11, and free for ages 3 and younger. Other seasonal farm highlights include a life-size “Hayflower” where visitors can learn about the Mayflower; record-breaking giant pumpkins on display; hayrides to the U-pick pumpkin patch with Pilgrim Bob; a menagerie of farm animals; fall décor in the country store; and pie-eating contests.
Enjoy U-pick patches of heirloom winter squash and pumpkin varieties. Farm stand stocks carrots, kale, cucumbers, salad mix and radishes. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday.
80432 Delight Valley School Road Cottage Grove OR

Fall highlights include a U-pick pumpkin patch, U-pick peppers for salsa making, fall décor with gourds, winter squash and fall produce including apples, and U-pick dahlias while they last. Weekend hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Friday and Saturday; noon to 5 p.m. Sunday.
River Bend Farms and Pleasant Hil Orchard

Seasonal farmgrown goodies include U-pick and already picked apples and Asian pears; apple cider; hazelnuts (these will be available by end of October). Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday; noon to 4 p.m. Sunday, through October.
River Bend Farms and Pleasant Hill Orchard

In addition to a U-pick pumpkin patch, several special events unfold here in October, with a showing of the movie “Hocus Pocus” at 6:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 3, with a roaring fire with hot dogs and smores kits for purchase; a Bounce House event from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 10; an appearance from Zany Zoo at 11 a.m. Oct. 17; tasty goodies with the characters of “The Wizard of Oz” from 9 a.m. to noon Oct. 24. Weekend hours: 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Friday through Sunday, unless otherwise noted.

Pick from many varieties of apples and other seasonal produce, as well as plenty of fall décor, including corn stalks and Indian corn, gourds and fall mums. Take a horse-drawn wagon ride on weekends to the U-pick pumpkin patch ($3.50 per person). Treats include ice cream, jams and jellies, doughnuts and pastries, and fresh apple cider. Weekend hours: 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Friday through Sunday.
